subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Can We Post Msgs In QuikScript?
msgSnippet: hi, usually your e-mail program will have an option to send and receive mail as html. if you have outlook 2003 go to the tools menu, then options, then click
messageBody:
hi,
 
usually your e-mail program will have an option to send and receive mail as html.
 
if you have outlook 2003 go to the tools menu, then options, then click the mail format tab.
 
then you'll be able to send in html.
 
or for an individual message from outlook go to format and select html.
 
cCz
 
ed
 
 

From: x1skycycle [mailto:x1skycycle@...]
Sent: Saturday, September 11, 2004 4:38 PM
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Can We Post Msgs In QuikScript?

<html>
<head>
<title>qs</title>
</head>

<body>
<font face="jerome">
<h1></h1>

<p>Hs z H wE t d i.

</body>
</html>


--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "jeff_smith_8992" <jeff_smith_8992@y...> wrote:
> Chuck,
> I'm still missing something...
>
>
You say, "compose your message as HTML".  Is there a way to do this in
> the Yahoo message box (the text box you see when you post a message
or
> reply to someone's message)?  Or do you have to do this in
another,
> external program?
>
> If I use a text editor like
"Microsoft Word" to compose my message
> (using a QuikScript font), I can
save it as an html file, but if I do
> it this way, how do I post that
file to this eGroup?
>
> Thanks,
> Jeff
>
> ---
In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Chuck Peck <chuck091956@o...> wrote:
> > Hello All,
> > 
> > It pretty easy,
just compose your message as HTML and set the fond
> to Jerome
> > ot another QS font and type away. As long as the people receiving
the
> > message has the same font or font group, they'll see your
e-mail as
> QS. The
> > Yahoo Group system supports HTML and
fonts.
> > 
> > Chuck Peck
> > 
> >
> >
> >   _____ 
> >
> > From: x1skycycle [mailto:x1skycycle@y...]
> > Sent: Saturday,
September 04, 2004 11:50 AM
> > To:
Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Can We
Post Msgs In QuikScript?
> >
> >
> > Chuck Peck
knows how to do it. (see message #548)
> > Go on Chuck, tell us how you
did it!
> >
> > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com,
"jeff_smith_8992"
> > <jeff_smith_8992@y...> wrote:
> > > This is probably dumb question but since I don't know the answer,
I'll
> > > ask it anyway...
> > >
> > > I
was under the impression that Yahoo eGroups messages could only be
> > > written in pure ascii text, and that it would ignore any text
> > > formatting.  And that's why our messages on this forum aren't
written
> > > in QuikScript fonts.  But I happened to be
skimming through some of
> > > the old messages in the archives and
I noticed that there are several
> > > that properly display
QuikScript text (see messages #9 and #18 from
> > > Jon Zuck). 
But then there are others that don't display properly (see
> > > msg
#176).
> > >
> > > So my question is can we post
messages to this group in QuikScript?
> > > Is there some secret
method?  Or did Yahoo change something that now
> > > prevents
formatted text?
> > >
> > > Thanks,
> > >
Jeff
> >

hi,
 
usually your e-mail program will have an option to send and receive mail as
html.
 
if you have outlook 2003 go to the tools menu, then options, then click the
mail format tab. 
 
then you'll be able to send in html.
 
or for an individual message from outlook go to format and select html.
 
cCz
